title: Kingsford Forest Country Park Walking Route

images.title: P L Chadwick / Picnic area by Blakeshall car park, Kingsford Forest Park
images.caption: Picnic area by Blakeshall car park. Kingsford Forest Park contains 200 acres of mixed woodland and heathland. It is in the northwest of Worcestershire. Just over the county border in Staffordshire is Kinver Edge and the village of Kinver. By the Blakeshall car park is this small wooded picnic area with several picnic tables.

images.title: P L Chadwick / Dog walking in Kingsford Forest Park
images.caption: Dog walking in Kingsford Forest Park. The attractive Kingsford Forest Park is popular with many different types of visitor. These include walkers, naturalists, bird spotters, cyclists, horse riders, dogs and their walkers. Here two dogs take their human companion for a brisk trot. They are walking on the Horse Route as can be seen by the evidence in the foreground.

images.title: P L Chadwick / Footpath in Kingsford Forest Park
images.caption: This footpath leads out of the forest and onto Blakeshall Lane.

images.title: Philip Halling / Kingsford Forest Park
images.caption: There are a number of parking areas at the site. This one is the Blakeshall Lane Car Park.

description: Explore 200 acres of woodland and heathland in this Worcestershire based forest park. Terrain in the park consists of hills and cliffs, with sandy paths crossing the area.  The park has 4 waymarked trails of varying lenghts to explore. The route below also visits the National Trust owned Kinver Edge . This woodland sandstone ridge offers dramatic views across surrounding counties and miles of heathland walking. Kingsford park is located about four miles west of Stourbridge, and four miles north of Kidderminster. There are three great options for continuing your walk through this lovely part of England. The Staffordshire Way , the North Worcestershire Path , and the Worcestershire Way all run past the park.
